questions.question: Which kubectl command is used to create a new Pod from a YAML file?
questions.explanation: kubectl apply -f pod.yaml is the recommended way to create or update resources using declarative configuration files.

questions.question: What command would you use to list all namespaces in the cluster?
questions.explanation: kubectl get ns is the standard command to list all namespaces in a Kubernetes cluster. You can also use the full form: kubectl get namespaces

questions.question: How many pods are in the 'practice-apps' namespace?
questions.explanation: The command 'kubectl get pods -n practice-apps --no-headers | wc -l' will give you an accurate count of pods. The --no-headers flag removes the header line, ensuring the count is accurate.
